description: 20 minutes is all you need for a Thai coconut curry soup filled with veggies and bursting with flavor! It's uber healthy and a perfect well rounded meal for the whole family.
keywords: easy curry coup, healthy thai soup
name: 20 Minute Thai Coconut Curry Soup
recipeIngredient: 3 cups sliced mixed mushrooms (, 8 ounces (I used crimini and shitake)
1 3/4 cups sliced mixed peppers (, 8 ounces (I used shishito, red, jalapeno)
1/2 teaspoon sea salt (, optional (curry paste has salt so if you’re low salt don’t add)
1 1/4 cups chickpeas (, rinsed and drained (about a 15 ounce can)
1/4 cup chopped cilantro (, measure packed (about 3/4 of an ounce)
2-3 tablespoons red curry paste (, adjust for your spice preference)
2 1/4 cups light coconut milk (about 1 1/2 13.6 fluid ounce/403 ml cans)
2 1/4 cup veggie broth (, low sodium (or use regular and adjust salt)
4 cups Asian style greens mix (, 5 ounce container (I used the Earthbound farm brand)
2 teaspoons rice vinegar (, can use white wine vinegar too)
1-2 teaspoons sesame oil (, adjust for personal preference (see note)

recipeInstructions.text: Saute the mushrooms, peppers, onion, garlic and salt in a soup pot with a drizzle of oil or broth until soft. About 7-8 minutes.
Add in the chickpeas, cilantro and curry paste. Cook 2-3 minutes until everything is mixed well.
Add in the coconut milk, broth and lime. Bring to a boil. About 5 minutes.
Add in the greens, stir to wilt them.
